item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Tuesday, May 20, 2025 at 7:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Introducing Veo 3 and Imagen 4, and a new tool for filmmaking called Flow (151 points | 78 comments)
2. Announcing Gemma 3n preview: powerful, efficient, mobile-first AI (37 points | 6 comments)
3. Deep Learning Is Applied Topology (251 points | 131 comments)
4. Robin: A multi-agent system for automating scientific discovery (62 points | 12 comments)
5. Show HN: 90s.dev - game maker that runs on the web (140 points | 56 comments)
6. Show HN: A Tiling Window Manager for Windows, Written in Janet (132 points | 34 comments)
7. The Dawn of Nvidia's Technology (43 points | 8 comments)
8. 27000 Dragons and 10'000 Lights: GPU-Driven Clustered Forward Renderer (55 points | 14 comments)
9. Show HN: Juvio – UV Kernel for Jupyter (43 points | 14 comments)
10. Ashby (YC W19) Is Hiring Engineering Managers ( | hide)
11. Google AI Ultra (13 points | discuss)
12. On-device small language models with multimodality, RAG, and Function Calling (5 points | discuss)
13. The emoji problem (2022) (266 points | 42 comments)
14. Show HN: Olelo Foil - NACA Airfoil Sim (18 points | 6 comments)
15. Teachable Machine (39 points | 7 comments)
16. The Fractured Entangled Representation Hypothesis (35 points | 20 comments)
17. The NSA Selector (5 points | discuss)
18. Making Video Games (Without an Engine) in 2025 (433 points | 185 comments)
19. The Last Letter (28 points | 5 comments)
20. The Lisp in the Cellar: Dependent types that live upstairs [pdf] (64 points | 12 comments)
21. Gail Wellington, Commodore Software Prod Mgr "and Mother of CDTV", Has Died (26 points | 6 comments)
22. Production tests: a guidebook for better systems and more sleep (35 points | 4 comments)
23. Launch HN: Opusense (YC X25) – AI assistant for construction inspectors on site (18 points | 11 comments)
24. A simple search engine from scratch (203 points | 41 comments)
25. OpenAI Codex Review (89 points | 44 comments)
26. llm-d, Kubernetes native distributed inference (82 points | 13 comments)
27. Show HN: Astra – a new js2exe compiler (42 points | 23 comments)
28. Google is quietly giving Amazon a leg up in digital book sales (60 points | 27 comments)
29. Compiling OCaml to the TI-84 CE Calculator (81 points | 3 comments)
30. DDoSecrets publishes 410 GB of heap dumps, hacked from TeleMessage (610 points | 169 comments)
